keyTakeAways: A former New York state prison guard, Robert Brooks, died after being brutally beaten by correctional officers at Marcy Correctional Facility on the night of December 9, 2024.

The body-camera footage of the beating, which was silent but clearly showed guards punching, stomping, and lifting Brooks by the neck, was central to the prosecution's case and sparked public outrage.

David Kingsley was found guilty of murder and first-degree manslaughter; Mathew Galliher and Nicholas Kieffer were acquitted of murder charges, though Kieffer and Galliher were found not guilty on second-degree gang assault charges.
Defense attorneys argued that the defendants should not be held responsible for the actions of other guards, emphasizing individual actions rather than collective culpability.
Special prosecutor William Fitzpatrick, who took over due to Attorney General Letitia James’s recusal, is prosecuting multiple cases involving prison violence, including the Nantwi incident.
Brooks had a 12-year sentence for first-degree assault and was transferred to Marcy Correctional Facility the night of the beating.

Six of the ten guards indicted in February were charged with murder, with five previously pleading guilty to manslaughter and one pleading guilty to a misdemeanor charge of attempted tampering with physical evidence.
Three more guards have agreed to plead guilty to reduced charges and are cooperating with prosecutors, including two who testified at the trial.

summaryOfNewsArticle: A former New York state prison guard, Robert Brooks, died after being brutally beaten at Marcy Correctional Facility on December 9, 2024. The incident, captured on silent body-camera footage, showed guards punching, stomping, and lifting him by the neck, leading to widespread public outrage. A jury found David Kingsley guilty of murder and first-degree manslaughter, while Mathew Galliher and Nicholas Kieffer were acquitted of murder charges. The prosecution argued that all guards acted as a gang and showed depraved indifference to human life, but the defense claimed individual actions did not meet the standard for serious criminal liability. William Fitzpatrick, a special prosecutor appointed after Attorney General Letitia James recused herself, is leading the investigation into both the Brooks and Nantwi cases, with additional guards facing trial or pleading guilty to reduced charges. This case highlights systemic issues in prison violence and the role of independent legal oversight.
title: Former New York State Prison Guard Found Guilty in Death of Inmate Beaten, 2 Others Acquitted
